result.execSummary:
The defendant Lathan J. Beine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to 13 days presentence credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay restitution and all applicable fees and surcharges within the term of probation.  Same to be paid through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts - payment plan to be established within 60 days.

Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within the term of probation.  Same to be paid through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts - payment plan to be established within 60 days. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.

Defendant shall undergo and follow through with drug treatment and counseling as ordered by Agent.
Jail to allow Defendant to make a phone call to Dodge County Human Services to set up appointment for treatment.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber (for employment and treatment), work program and community service program privileges and Transfer to commence immediately.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

(11:31) Defendant Lathan J. Beine in court, in custody with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; discussion on credit - 13 days; there was request to Amend Information - State will withdraw that motion if Def. pleads to one count of Forgery (others listed in request will be treated as uncharged read-ins); Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; victim rights complied with; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Forgery; parties stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FV&K and finds Def. guilty of Count 1 Forgery with Count 2 D&RI (w/uncharged read ins listed in proposed Amended Information); State heard (has charges pending in Washington County); Atty. Terry heard; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded (11:55)

**W/H - 3 years PO - 13 days credit if revoked
- 45 days in DCJ w/Huber for employment and treatment, work program and community service program &Tr. to comm. immediately
- CC $268
- DNA sample and surcharge $250
- $603.25 Restitution to Horicon State Bank (Financials to be collected by Clerk of Courts)
- Drug treatment and counseling as ordered by Agent and follow through

* jail to allow Def. to make call to Dodge County Human Services to set up appointment for treatment
